title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
shortDesc: A classic novel set in the 1920s.
longDesc: The Great Gatsby is a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald that follows the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
shortDesc: A powerful story of racial injustice and moral growth.
longDesc: To Kill a Mockingbird is a classic novel that addresses issues of racial inequality and moral development through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
shortDesc: A chilling dystopian vision of the future.
longDesc: 1984 presents a grim vision of a totalitarian society ruled by a government that controls every aspect of its citizens' lives.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
shortDesc: A classic romance novel set in the 19th century.
longDesc: Pride and Prejudice follows the story of Elizabeth Bennet and her complicated relationship with the wealthy Mr. Darcy.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
longDesc: The Fellowship of the Ring is the first volume of J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy novel, The Lord of the Rings, set in the world of Middle-earth.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
longDesc: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone introduces readers to the magical world of Hogwarts and follows the young wizard Harry Potter on his journey.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
longDesc: Brave New World is a dystopian novel that envisions a society where scientific and technological advancements control human life.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
longDesc: The Catcher in the Rye follows the journey of Holden Caulfield as he navigates the complexities of adolescence and adulthood.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
longDesc: The Hobbit is a timeless adventure story that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on an epic quest with a group of dwarves.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
longDesc: Jane Eyre is a Gothic novel that explores themes of love, independence, and societal expectations.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
longDesc: The Hunger Games is a dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic world, where young tributes must fight to the death in a televised event.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
shortDesc: A gripping thriller with art and religious symbolism.
longDesc: The Da Vinci Code follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he unravels a mystery involving religious symbolism and art history.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
longDesc: The Alchemist tells the story of Santiago, a shepherd boy who sets out on a journey to find his personal legend.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
shortDesc: A dark and philosophical Gothic novel.
longDesc: The Picture of Dorian Gray explores themes of hedonism, vanity, and morality through the story of a young man who remains eternally young while his portrait ages.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
shortDesc: A chilling and thought-provoking dystopian novel.
longDesc: The Handmaid's Tale is a speculative fiction novel that depicts a totalitarian society where fertile women are enslaved as childbearers.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
shortDesc: An epic adventure of man versus nature.
longDesc: Moby-Dick is a novel that tells the story of Captain Ahab's obsession with hunting the great white whale that took his leg.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
shortDesc: A beloved fantasy classic for children and adults.
longDesc: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe is the first book in The Chronicles of Narnia series, where children stumble into a magical land called Narnia.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
shortDesc: A seminal work of Gothic horror and science fiction.
longDesc: Frankenstein explores themes of creation, ambition, and the consequences of playing god through the story of Dr. Victor Frankenstein and his monstrous creation.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
shortDesc: A haunting and suspenseful horror novel.
longDesc: The Shining tells the story of a family trapped in a haunted and isolated hotel during the winter season.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
shortDesc: A poignant and beautifully written tale set in Nazi Germany.
longDesc: The Book Thief is a historical fiction novel narrated by Death, following the story of a young girl who steals books to share with others during World War II.
